item.title: Rubbish dumped by the litter bin on Picardy Road Belvedere DA17 near the 401 bus stop, 22nd June
item.description:
A large quantity of rubbish has been dumped by the litter bin on Picardy Road Belvedere DA17 near the 401/469 Bus Stop, approximately 25 metres from the junction with Halt Robin Road. Would arrangements be put in place to remove the rubbish as soon as practical.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Picardy Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black bin waste constantly left on side of road every week, 22nd June
item.description:
The bin collection system for Palace Square Flats has been a mess for over a year. Black bins are taken out by the bin men too early and left lining the pavement for a whole week â€” they overflow, attract foxes, rodents and spill rubbish all over the street. It's disgusting, unsafe, and needs sorting out urgently. The bin men should not be doing this it is ruining the area. Bromley Council, please fix this!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Vale, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Assortment of rubbish piled up on the pavement Northfield Rd EN3, 22nd June
item.description:
Assortment of rubbish piled up on the pavement in Northfield Rd EN3 on the corner with Oxford Rd EN3. Northfield Rd EN3 is a regular dumping ground, cameras and heavy fines needed as same people dumping there regular and getting away with it!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oxford Road, Southbury, London

item.title: Pallets tide to trees and lamposts., 22nd June
item.description:
Morning Team I would like to raise a complaint about the photos I have provided on this email. Bexley needs to remove these pallets tide against lamposts/trees as this makes the area look untidy and not a good look everyday coming out of my house to see these. It should not be my responsibility to remove these and I am sure you have not authorised the building company to display these either. The company should be given a warning about doing this. The first sign is in Stanstead Crescent, Bexley, Junction of Hurst Road DA5 3AG and then there is also one tide against the tree on the Eynsford Crescent junction of Hurst Road opposite 339 Hurst Road. There is a further sign (illegally displayed) in Festival Close, Junction of Eynsford Crescent. Please advise on when these are being removed or I am happy to contact Cllr Baroness directly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Stansted Crescent, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another abandoned Lime bike, 22nd June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Milk Street, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin needs to be installed at bus stop Q on Mottingham road, 22nd June
item.description:
A bin needs to be installed at bus stop Q Mottingham Road SE9 4SZ. Every day people drop litter at the bus stop and on the grass verge while waiting for buses. If Bromley Council installed a bin it would be more likely that people would use the bin rather than dropping their rubbish. Our children play outside with neighbours and it's disgusting and dangerous especially with broken bottles. Every other bus stop in the area has a bin except for this one. There is plenty of space around for one that would not cause any obstruction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mottingham Road, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rotted tree branch broken away is hanging down onto pavement, 22nd June
item.description:
Rotted tree branch broken away is hanging down onto the pavement in Galliard Rd N9. It appears their is little maintenance or care of our trees being carried out in Edmonton as this is the second one I have reported within a few weeks. Eventually there is going to be a serious accident if this continues. I am not anti trees but please look after what we have.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 164, Galliard Road, Ponders End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Overflowing bin, yet again!, 22nd June
item.description:
Public bin overflowing. This is happening so frequently I wonder whether Greenwich Council are reducing their street sweeping. This is really unhygienic unsightly and encourages vermin. Please review your bin emptying schedule.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Kidbrooke Grove, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet
